enWisdom: The living one is never satisfied [and always seeks more]
A believer loathes idle play and likes to work hard

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالْجِدِّ وَالِاجْتِهَادِ فِي إِصْلَاحِ الْمَعَادِ
enWisdom: You must work hard and struggle to improve your Hereafter

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالْجِدِّ وَإِنْ لَمْ يُسَاعِدِ الْجَدُّ
enWisdom: You must be diligent even if you are not assisted by [good] fortune
One who falls short is deficient

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُجْهِدْ نَفْسَهُ فِي صِغَرِهِ لَمْ يَنْبُلْ فِي كِبَرِهِ
enWisdom: One who does not struggle against his [carnal] soul in his young age does not become noble in is old age

Wisdom: مَا أَدْرَكَ الْمَجْدَ مَنْ فَاتَهُ الْجِدُّ
enWisdom: One who lacks diligence does not attain distinction
The ideal [person] is one whose seriousness prevails over his jesting [and frivolity]

Wisdom: إِنْ كُنْتُمْ لَا مَحَالَةَ مُتَنَافِسِينَ فَتَنَافَسُوا فِي الْخِصَالِ الرَّغِيبَةِ وَخِلَالِ الْمَجْدِ
enWisdom: If you must compete with each other, then vie for [acquiring] desirable qualities and praiseworthy traits

Wisdom: لَنْ يَضِيعَ مِنْ سَعْيِكَ مَا أَصْلَحَكَ وَأَكْسَبَكَ الْأَجْرَ
